summary: This bill, the Protecting American Research and Talent Act, aims to restrict federal funding for fundamental research collaborations between institutions of higher education and "covered entities." Covered entities include certain Chinese academic institutions and those involved with the Chinese military. The bill allows for waivers from this prohibition, granted by federal agencies under national security interests, but mandates reporting to Congress on any waivers granted. The bill defines key terms like "collaboration," "covered entity," and "fundamental research."
